abstract: Roman Catholic Pope Francis tells Vatican general audience to be merciful and welcoming to remarried and divorced Catholics and their children encouraging them to participate as much as possible in church life.
lead_paragraph: In his first remarks to his general audience after a summer break, Francis reminded church leaders that divorced Catholics who remarry “are not at all excommunicated.”

headline.main: Pope Francis Urges Priests to Welcome Remarried Catholics
headline.print_headline: Pope Tells Clergy That Remarried Catholics and Their Children Are Still Welcome
